org.sd.bdb
Class DbHandle

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.bdb.DbHandle

public class DbHandle
extends java.lang.Object

Handle on a berkeley database with transactional db read/write methods.

Author:
Spence Koehler

hasTimestampedDb

public boolean hasTimestampedDb()
Report whether this handle's database has an associated timestamped database.

isClosed

public boolean isClosed()
Determine whether this instance has been closed.

close

public final void close()
Close this handle's database.

NOTE: This will automatically be called when the spawning BerkeleyDb instance is closed, but re-closing will have no determinental side-effects.

put

public final void put(long key,
                      DbValue value)
Put the value associated with the key.

public final void put(java.lang.String key,

push

public final void push(long key,
                       DbValue value)
Push the value associated with the key to the 'beginning'.

NOTE: This is only meaningful when a timestamped db is being used. The 'pushed' value will be inserted as if before the first value in the database.

push

public final void push(java.lang.String key,
                       DbValue value)

update

public final boolean update(long key,
                            DbValue newValue,
                            java.lang.Long oldTimestamp)
Update the record with the given key to have the new value.

If the record doesn't exist, then return false without adding it.

If oldTimestamp is non-null and timestamps are warranted, keep the oldTimestamp with the new updated value.

Returns:
true if the record existed and was updated; otherwise, false.

update

public final boolean update(java.lang.String key,
                            DbValue newValue,
                            java.lang.Long oldTimestamp)
Update the record with the given key to have the new value.

If the record doesn't exist, then return false without adding it.

If oldTimestamp is non-null and timestamps are warranted, keep the oldTimestamp with the new updated value.

Returns:
true if the record existed and was updated; otherwise, false.

load

public final long load(DbHandle other)
Load all entries from the other db handle into this handle's db, replacing this db's with the other's on finding duplicates.

Returns:
the number of entries loaded.

iterator

public final DbIterator<StringKeyValuePair> iterator(DbTraversal traversalType)
Get an iterator over the database entries, where the keys are strings.

NOTE: Remember to close the iterator in a finally block when finished!

iteratorLong

public final DbIterator<LongKeyValuePair> iteratorLong(DbTraversal traversalType)
Get an iterator over the database entries, where the keys are longs.

NOTE: Remember to close the iterator in a finally block when finished!
